snippet: The Obama administration said Monday that employers must offer health insurance to employees and their children, but will not be subject to any penalties if family coverage is unaffordable to workers.
abstract: Obama administration, in long-awaited interpretation of new health care law, says employers must offer health insurance to employees and their children, but will not be subject to any penalties if family coverage is unaffordable to workers.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said Monday that employers must offer health insurance to employees and their children, but will not be subject to any penalties if family coverage is unaffordable to workers.

headline.seo: Employers Must Offer Family Health Care, Affordable or Not, Administration Says
headline.main: Employers Must Offer Family Care, Affordable or Not
headline.print_headline: Employers Must Offer Family Care, Affordable or Not

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
